meanings.definition: A pair of thin layers of sediment, one light and one dark, that are deposited annually in a lake bed.
meanings.sent1: The varve in the lake bed showed alternating light and dark layers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study varves to understand the history of the lake's sedimentation.
meanings.sent3: The varve decided to wear a light layer on top and a dark layer underneath for the annual sediment fashion show.
meanings.sent4: The varve of time, with its light and dark layers, revealed the passage of years.
meanings.sent5: As the varve settled, it left behind a record of each passing year in the lake bed.

meanings.sent5: The artist's brush varves colors on the canvas, creating a masterpiece of layers.
